issues.title: Allow for choosing from My Repos during a Pull request
issues.body:
Would be nice to be able to pick the repo and branch from your repos when creating a pull request, rather than having to put in the address/branch manually.

Of course we should still leave in the manual option if someone wants to create a request with a repo than isn't theirs (and thus they client may not know about it).

But since most of the time people are opening PRs from their own repos, it would be nice to be able to choose from them :)

issues.title: Ability for repo maintainer to close other's issues
issues.body:
There are quite a few issues stacking up over on http://127.0.0.1:43110/1GitLiXB6t5r8vuU2zC6a8GYj9ME6HMQ4t/repo/issues/?1Code5125iycoEFCMi9a4XVejFwauoyGqj

Many of these I've solved, but they remain open simply because I am unable to close them if I didn't make them: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1GitLiXB6t5r8vuU2zC6a8GYj9ME6HMQ4t/repo/issues/view/?1Code5125iycoEFCMi9a4XVejFwauoyGqj/5@1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS

I know we can't edit other's data, but would it be possible to extract the open or closed state of an issue from the issue itself, where you simply have a table with `"issue_id": 1|0, "date": 1234567`, which could be updated if not already present, and in the site just check for the latest update and whether the user was authorized to make it?

This really is an essential feature for keeping a growing project in check. Would very much appreciate it!

issues.title: Pull Requests icon should be black
issues.body: It's confusing visually having all icons at the top be black except for one that's _not quite black_. I suggest either changing it be consistent with the other icons, or giving the other icons colors themselves.

issue_comments.body: Can you store the repo address in the index, the check through the index and find the repo if the URL contains a .bit address?

This seems to work now, you can close this, thanks!

http://127.0.0.1:43110/repo.zerolstn.bit
Possibly have the repo maintainer be able to "refresh" and store the current language statistics.
Making this work with PR's should work as well btw.

For some reason when this is called: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1GitLiXB6t5r8vuU2zC6a8GYj9ME6HMQ4t/repo/file/?18r929Hq8hE5Pi9Zf7ovMQVyn3WcGfxMgu/main/dist/repo/js/objects_view.js@master#L296

objects.owned is false, leading the "Comment and close issue" button to not be shown on screen.

For issues specifically, this method is called by this code: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1GitLiXB6t5r8vuU2zC6a8GYj9ME6HMQ4t/repo/file/?18r929Hq8hE5Pi9Zf7ovMQVyn3WcGfxMgu/main/dist/repo/issues/view/js/main.js@master#L48

Which grabs the issue object from this query: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1GitLiXB6t5r8vuU2zC6a8GYj9ME6HMQ4t/repo/file/?18r929Hq8hE5Pi9Zf7ovMQVyn3WcGfxMgu/main/dist/js/issues.js@master#L102

And uses this method to check if the current repo is "signable" or not: https://github.com/imachug/ZeroDevLib/blob/64e662e0148470bf4e2d42f4305d3c5e609b2cbd/ZeroPage.js#L243-L253

Which I've found is always returning `false` for issues in my repo, meaning I can't close any issues besides my own.

Not sure if this is a ZeroNet bug with siteInfo not having my privatekey or in how gitcenter is handling it. I don't see any `privatekey` field in the ZeroFrame documentation, so I'm not quite sure: https://zeronet.readthedocs.io/en/latest/site_development/zeroframe_api_reference/#siteinfo
For the moment I've just gone in and set `objects.owner` to always be true, so I can close issues now, but this obviously isn't super ideal :)

Perhaps this could be part of it. It's using my ZeroID private key to sign the site when I close issues, rather than the actual merger site's private key: http://bayimg.com/d8f8d026acd2ecc3df7bf13b50a78abcb3318b21.jpg

I wonder if I add myself to the signers field in `content.json`...
